findings.rationale: Capping liability limits the recourse available to a party in case of significant damages, potentially leaving them exposed to financial risk.
findings.evidence_quote: Liability is capped at the greater of $1,000,000 or the annual contract value, except for indemnification obligations.

findings.rationale: Providing services on an 'as-is' basis without warranties may expose the client to risks related to service quality and performance issues.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider provides services on an 'as-is' basis with no warranties.

findings.rationale: The ability for either party to terminate for convenience with only 90 days notice may introduce instability and uncertainty in the partnership.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate for convenience with 90 days written notice.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at the annual contract value may not cover all potential claims, leaving one party vulnerable to larger liabilities.
findings.evidence_quote: Mutual indemnification: each party indemnifies the other for claims arising from its own negligence, capped at the annual contract value.

findings.rationale: While confidentiality obligations are important, a 5-year duration may not be sufficient for all sensitive information, depending on the nature of the data.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 5 years after termination.
